pageContext.description: Circular central socket, pierced by single rivet hole near the mouth, slightly tapering, and terminating in a cross piece decorated at each end with a spherical boss. From near the base of the socket springs, on each side, a thin lunate plate of bronze, which narrows slightly towards the top, which is terminated with the spherical bosses. The upper end of the socket is open.
pageContext.thickness: Base of socket 19; Top of socket 7; greatest thickness of plates 3; plates along outer edge 1
pageContext.patina: Golden bronze, with traces of black patina.
pageContext.surface: Generally smooth except for clipped pitting on side of socket
pageContext.remarks: Compare other "standard fittings" from St. Leonards, Longstone, Derbyshire, and Tower St., London
